Steven Tyler , 62, revealed on`` The Late Show with David Letterman '' Monday that during the accident- which led to broken bones and the cancellation of Aerosmith's tour- he was high. It's not any news here about my drug use and addictions in the past, the frontman said when asked about the tumble.`` A couple years ago, you know, I was doing Lunesta because I had some problems with my feet.'' Sunday. Media reports during Egypt's political unrest had quoted Zahi Hawass as saying that looters damaged two mummies, but in a BBC interview on Sunday he said that this was not the case. They were not mummies, there were two skulls taken outside from the CT scan machine. Everything will go back to normal at Cairo Museum today, said Zahi Hawass , head of Egypt's antiquities authority since 2002. He was made a cabinet minister last week.
